titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Aron Cypen "Cy" Lubitsh was born in the Soviet Union, immigrated to Canada and subsequently immigrated to the United States in 1937. Lubitsh worked as a commercial artist and photographer in New York City. He earned a Master's in art at Columbia University. He worked and studied under the Russian-born sculptor Alexander Archipenko. In 1943 Lubitsh was drafted into the Army, and was assigned to the 166th Signal Photographic Company, Camp Crowder, Missouri. His unit was sent to France in 1944, landing at Normandy while the D-Day invasion was still underway. The unit was assigned to Third Army throughout the campaigns in France and Germany. Lubitsh received the Bronze Star, and was honorably discharged in the fall of 1945. In 1964, Lubitsh's photos of the war were exhibited at the Delaware Art Center.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of over 1,000 personal and professional photo negatives and photographs from the 1940s to 1960s from the studio of A. Cypen Lubitsh, Bronx, New York, and later Wilmington, Delaware. Subjects include: portraits of children, theatrical and dance portraits, weddings, marina and waterfront scenes, racetracks, airplanes, animals and rural scenes, beach scenes, and travel photography from Europe to Arizona to Gloucester, Massachusetts. The collection also includes images of still lifes, and photographs of Lubitsh's own artwork in paintings and sculpture.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Military History Institute at Carlisle Barracks: A. Cypen Lubitsh military photos
